instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> EMC1412-A not there, should it be?
threads.message:
Looking at an empty space where <CHIP>U5520</CHIP> would be. The schematic does not say no stuff but it's not there.
This board has previously been worked on so I wonder if someone stole it?

No. Just looked at another one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> EMC1412-A not there, should it be?
threads.message: <CHIP>U5520</CHIP> should be there but it won't affect the board at least turning on and chiming.
